alert.note: Alert for Lee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 01 at 4:06PM EST until February 03 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Kinchafoonee Creek near 11 E Of Dawson At Pinewood Rd In Lee County affecting Lee County. For the Kinchafoonee Creek...including 11 E Of Dawson At Pinewood Rd In Lee County...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kinchafoonee Creek near 11 E Of Dawson At Pinewood Rd In Lee County. * WHEN...From this evening to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water floods into wooded areas and farmland downstream from the gauge. Further downstream water moves out of the bank along Creekside Drive, especially south of Kinchafoonee Creek Road as well as in the 400 block of Creekside Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 13.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 08/20/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
